subclusters.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
Membrane Lipid Raft Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
Membrane Physical Properties and Intracellular Density Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related changes in membrane lipid composition, increased rigidity, and lipid peroxidation linking oxidative stress to membrane dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes membrane fatty acid composition affecting metabolic rate and lifespan via susceptibility to peroxidation and oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links membrane lipid unsaturation and peroxidation to aging rate, highlighting adaptive lipid remodeling reducing oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes longevity-homeoviscous adaptation linking membrane fatty acid unsaturation, lipid peroxidation susceptibility, and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details age-related increase in membrane microviscosity due to lipid changes and free radical damage affecting membrane function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-dependent membrane rigidity increase impairing protein diffusion and enzyme activity, linked to lipid changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights membrane vulnerability to free radical damage causing permeability loss, intracellular dehydration, and functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes free radical-induced membrane lipid peroxidation and protein cross-linking causing decreased permeability and cellular dehydration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related decline in membrane protein lateral diffusion and permeability due to free radical damage and lipid peroxidation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on decreased lateral diffusion of membrane proteins with age, leading to permeability loss and increased intracellular density.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links cholesterol accumulation in membranes to increased microviscosity and decreased membrane enzyme activity during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows age-related membrane lipid changes increasing microviscosity and how dietary restriction preserves membrane fluidity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Membrane lipid peroxidation and reactive aldehydes cause membrane deterioration, disrupting cellular homeostasis and driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Membrane phospholipid unsaturation correlates with lifespan via lipid peroxidation affecting mitochondrial function and ROS production.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: LHA theory applied to fish links membrane lipid composition and peroxidation index to lifespan and metabolic rate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Composition and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Membrane lipid unsaturation influences metabolic rate, membrane fluidity, and susceptibility to oxidative damage affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Raft Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related loss of membrane lipid rafts, cholesterol depletion, and consequent neuronal signaling and plasticity decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Raft Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links membrane lipid packing changes to impaired insulin receptor signaling and neurodegeneration, emphasizing membrane environment.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Lipid Raft Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects free radical-induced membrane fluidity decline to NMDA receptor deficits and cognitive decline in aging brain.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reactive Oxygen Species-Induced Membrane Damage in Erythrocytes
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-driven oxidative damage to erythrocyte membranes causing proteolysis, IgG binding, and clearance of aged cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Physical Properties and Intracellular Density Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes age-related decline in lateral mobility of membrane proteins/lipids, intracellular dehydration, and enzyme activity loss.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Physical Properties and Intracellular Density Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes lifelong increase in intracellular density inhibits enzyme activities, underlying aging-related cellular decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Physical Properties and Intracellular Density Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes plasma membrane damage causing increased intracellular density, reduced enzyme catalytic rates, and compensatory enzyme expression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Physical Properties and Intracellular Density Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Attributes aging to plasma membrane alterations causing intracellular dehydration, enzyme activity decline, and modulation by hGH.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Physical Properties and Intracellular Density Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links plasma membrane damage and intracellular dry mass accumulation to slowed lysosomal degradation and biological waste buildup.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Membrane Physical Properties and Intracellular Density Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes increased intracellular dry mass and viscosity downregulate enzyme activities, underlying cell maturation and aging.
